conclusion: Initial conditions of blocks P and Q and friction details.
Collision between P and Q is elastic, conservation of momentum and energy applies.
Conservation of momentum equation setup before and after collision.
Simplified momentum equation: m * v_{P_{1}} = 4m * v_{Q_{1}}.
Maximum static friction equals sliding friction.
Simplified kinetic energy equation: v_{P_{1}}^2 = 4 * v_{Q_{1}}^2.
Final velocities derived from momentum and kinetic energy: v_{P_{1}} = 4v_{Q_{1}}.
Magnitude of velocity of P is 4v_{Q_{1}}, and velocity of Q is v_{Q_{1}}.
